Text:
This is just the x86 versions of win7sp1 brought up to date with kb files, directx runtime, ie9, and dotnet 4.5. The purpose is to fit on a single layer 4.5gb dvd. If you want the version with all 11 windows options brought up to date for dual layer dvd or flash drive, you want this:
http://thepiratebay.se/torrent/7619127/Windows_7_SP1_AIO_11in1_x64_x86_IE9_.Net_4.5_Sep10_2012

For the 6in1 x86 version you want this:
http://thepiratebay.se/torrent/7622548/Windows_7_SP1_AIO_6in1_x86_IE9_.Net_4.5_Sep11_2012
You mean this is the x64 version, not x86.

Yes my apologies, this is x64. There are a few updates available that just got hotfixed on sep11, but I will not make a new version of this until the Tuesday patch day in October. So don't fear downloading this for the time being.

Hello murphy78, you don't need to add DirectX runtimes on Windows 7 SP1 since DirectX 11 was already included in Windows 7 when SP1 was released on March 18, 2010 and KB2533552 patch is not recessary, even if you don't install this update, future updates are enabled one way or the other.
